commitResults.messageTitle: Changed Chatbot name to Ratzchat.
Changed to echo user input unless input is bye.
Store input as list and prints list
Added class "Task", mark and unmark todolist
Added Todos, Deadlines, Events (Level-4)
minor changes + implementing testing using I/O redirection technique
Error handling
Delete a task
Added function to save to local device. Also edited the delete function to work properly.
Slightly buggy code but added date time formatting
Test for branch 7
Making changes to OOP
Adding new classes Parse, Storage, TaskList, Ui
Add Parser.java, Storage.java, TaskList.java, Ui.java
commitResults.messageBody:
Class Duke.java contains code that can be split into classes of similar
behaviours.

Extracting the methods of similar behaviours can improve OOP. For
example, Parser can be used to handle user input and executing different
functions accordingly, while the details of creating a file to store the
tasks can be handed to Storage for clarity.

Let's split Duke.java into classes that hav similar behaviours into new
classes.

Using OOP practices can improve overall readability and clarity of the
code.

commitResults.messageTitle: Remove declaration of new Storage object.
Create classes Parser.java, Storage.java, TaskList.java, Ui.java
commitResults.messageBody:
Duke.java lacks clear class responsibilities, resulting in a less
modular and maintainable design.

To adhere to OOP principles and improve code organisation for
better maintainability.

Move user interaction logic to the Ui class for a cleaner separation
of concerns. Extract input parsing responsibilities into a dedicated
Parser class. Improve modularity by creating TaskList class to handle
task storage. Move file I/O operations into the Storage class for better
encapsulation.

To ensure each class has a single responsibility, making the code more
understandable and maintainable.

This change enhances overall code structure, making it easier to extend
and maintain in the future.

commitResults.messageTitle: Clean up Duke.java: Remove unnecessary comments
Merge branch 'more-OOP'

  Adding new classes Parse, Storage, TaskList, Ui

commitResults.messageTitle: Edit input handling and output formatting
commitResults.messageBody:
Rework Duke class to delegate input parsing responsibilities entirely to
the Parser class, enhancing separation of concerns and adhering more
closely to OOP principles. This change ensures that input parsing logic
is at one place, making the code easier to understand and maintain.

Modify the run method in Duke to adjust the timing and conditions under
which ui.printLine() is invoked. This prevents the double line print
issue at the end of the program execution, leading to cleaner and more
user-friendly output.

These adjustments improve the overall design and usability, improving
the user interaction experience by providing a clearer output format.
